content: baby and toddler mittens designed by julie taylor simple classic baby and toddler mittens with fold over cuffs the smaller sizes are thumbless making them easier to put on only the largest size has thumbs an original pattern from www lovefibres com lf049 baby & toddler mittens - copyright © julie taylor 2019 sizes approx age 0 - 6 months 6 - 12 months 1 - 2 years yarn yarn 1 1 1 dk weight 50 gram ball 50 gram ball 50 gram ball 50 metres 55 metres 65 metres 55 yards 60 yards 71 yards please use good quality yarn to ensure your item is safe for babies and children depending on who you are making the item for your yarn may need to be hypoallergenic merino wool silk bamboo alpaca cashmere cotton or acrylic fall into this category yarns with embedded sequins glitter tinsel or similar strands are not suitable babies and small children i have knit the samples using rico essentials merino dk any yarn with a suitable fibre content that knits to the specified gauge can be used the amount of yarn needed may vary if using other yarns you will also need 3 25 mm us size 3 straight knitting needles 4 mm us size 6 straight knitting needles tapestry needle for seaming and weaving in yarn ends please note that needle size is a suggestion only you may need to use different size needles to match the specified gauge gauge/gauge 22 sts and 30 row to 10 cm 4 in stocking stitch on 4 mm us size 6 needles please take time to knit and block a gauge square that is larger than 10 cm 4 to ensure you measure accurately if you have more than 22 sts to 10 cm 4 try knitting again using bigger needles if you have less than 22 sts to 10 cm 4 try again using smaller needles if you have not knit and blocked a gauge swatch before i have a blog post showing you how https //www lovefibres com/blog/how-to-knit-a-gauge-swatch 2 lf049 baby & toddler mittens - copyright © julie taylor 2019 abbreviations k = knit k2tog = knit two stitches together to make one stitch m1 = make one stitch by picking up the bar between the last and the next stitch and knitting into the back of it p = purl rs = right side st s = stitch es stocking stitch = right side row knit stitch wrong side row purl stitch tbl = through back loop = work the instructions in the brackets by the number of times indicated numbers are given for the smallest size with numbers for larger sizes in brackets if only one number is given it applies to all sizes links to video tutorials draw up stitches and secure https //youtu be/bwdksvzx3mc mattress stitch https //youtu be/jggyklr4hoy weaving in yarn ends over rib stitch https //youtu be/pyehpnamxke weaving in yarn ends over stocking stitch https //youtu be/7wg-8gdxaqs these and
